question_text:
In a far off land, a magical gem keeps the fairy palace safe. A mean witch breaks the gem into 3 equal pieces and scatters them into the wind. Sir Goodheart is a brave knight who promises to help the fairies by finding all the pieces. So far, Sir Goodheart has found 1 piece of the gem.

Which model represents the fraction of the gem that Sir Goodheart has found?
question_type: Multiple Choice Question with Single Answer
solution: The gem is the whole. The witch breaks it into 3 equal pieces, so we need a model with 3 equal parts.
Look at Model A: This circle is divided into 3 equal parts with 1 part colored. This shows $\frac{1}{3}$.
Look at Model B: This circle is divided into 4 equal parts with 1 part colored. This shows $\frac{1}{4}$.
Since the gem was broken into 3 equal pieces and Sir Goodheart found 1 piece, we need the model that shows $\frac{1}{3}$.
Therefore, Model A represents the fraction of the gem that Sir Goodheart has found.
image_choice_tags_backend_description: A circle (pie chart) divided into three sections. One section, colored in orange/peach, takes up approximately one-third of the circle (about 120 degrees). The remaining two-thirds of the circle is white/unfilled. The dividing lines extend from the center to the edge of the circle.

A circle divided into four equal quadrants by two perpendicular lines that intersect at the center. One quadrant (the top-right section) is filled with a light purple/lavender color, representing one-fourth or 25% of the circle. The other three quadrants are white/unfilled.

question_text:
In a magical world, a supply crate for the mission. The evil Beast Titan breaks it into 9 equal pieces and scatters them. Eren promises to find all the pieces. So far, Eren has found 3 pieces.

Which model represents the fraction that Eren has found?
question_type: Multiple Choice Question with Single Answer
solution: The supply crate is the whole. Beast Titan breaks it into 9 equal pieces.
Model A shows 9 parts with 3 colored: $\frac{3}{9}$.
Model B shows 5 parts with 3 colored: $\frac{3}{5}$.
We need the model showing $\frac{3}{9}$.
Therefore, Model A is correct.
image_choice_tags_backend_description: A circle divided into 9 sections. 3 sections colored in orange/peach, representing 3/9. The remaining sections are white.
A circle divided into 5 sections. 3 sections colored in purple, representing 3/5.

In a magical world, a philosopher stone for alchemy. The evil Father breaks it into 12 equal pieces and scatters them. Edward promises to find all the pieces. So far, Edward has found 10 pieces.

Which model represents the fraction that Edward has found?
question_type: Multiple Choice Question with Single Answer
solution: The philosopher stone is the whole. Father breaks it into 12 equal pieces.
Model A shows 12 parts with 10 colored: $\frac{10}{12}$.
Model B shows 5 parts with 4 colored: $\frac{4}{5}$.
We need the model showing $\frac{10}{12}$.
Therefore, Model A is correct.
image_choice_tags_backend_description: A circle divided into 12 sections. 10 sections colored in orange/peach, representing 10/12. The remaining sections are white.
A circle divided into 5 sections. 4 sections colored in purple, representing 4/5.

question_text:
In a magical world, a meat piece for the crew. The evil Blackbeard breaks it into 2 equal pieces and scatters them. Luffy promises to find all the pieces. So far, Luffy has found 1 piece.

Which model represents the fraction that Luffy has found?
question_type: Multiple Choice Question with Single Answer
solution: The meat piece is the whole. Blackbeard breaks it into 2 equal pieces.
Model A shows 2 parts with 1 colored: $\frac{1}{2}$.
Model B shows 8 parts with 1 colored: $\frac{1}{8}$.
We need the model showing $\frac{1}{2}$.
Therefore, Model A is correct.
image_choice_tags_backend_description: A circle divided into 2 sections. 1 section colored in orange/peach, representing 1/2. The remaining sections are white.
A circle divided into 8 sections. 1 section colored in purple, representing 1/8.
